articles.description: Ruben Amorim says he is the 'right guy at the right time' to turn Manchester United around.
articles.title: Ruben Amorim: New Manchester United boss says he is the 'right guy' for the job

articles.description: Pep Guardiola says he will stand by Manchester City even if they are relegated over alleged breaches of financial rules.
articles.title: Pep Guardiola promises to stay at Manchester City even if relegated

articles.description: World champions South Africa arrive in Cardiff to take on a Wales side facing the prospect of losing a 12th successive international.
articles.title: Wales v South Africa: Springboks aim to pile misery on Warren Gatland

articles.description: England captain Harry Kane makes history by reaching 50 Bundesliga goals at the fastest pace ever with a hat-trick for Bayern Munich against Augsburg.
articles.title: Bayern Munich 3-0 Augsburg: Harry Kane quickest player to 50 Bundesliga goals after hat-trick

articles.description: The New York Giants have "mutually agreed" to terminate the contract of quarterback Daniel Jones.
articles.title: Daniel Jones released: New York Giants part ways with struggling quarterback

articles.description: England head coach Steve Borthwick urges his players to persist with an attacking style of play despite three defeats this autumn.
articles.title: England v Japan: Steve Borthwick defends playing style despite poor run

articles.description: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca says Leicester City's Jamie Vardy is England's best striker in his generation before his side's trip to his former side.
articles.title: Jamie Vardy: Leicester striker better than Wayne Rooney and Harry Kane, says Chelsea's Enzo Maresca

articles.description: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani wins his third Most Valuable Player award after his team's World Series triumph.
articles.title: Shohei Ohtani: LA Dodgers star wins third Most Valuable Player award

articles.description: A majority of Premier League clubs approve changes to rules governing commercial deals.
articles.title: Associated Party Transaction rules: Premier League clubs approve changes to rules governing commercial deals

articles.description: Head coach Gerardo Martino has stepped down from his role with MLS club Inter Miami "due to personal reasons", the club confirms.
articles.title: Inter Miami: Head coach Gerardo Martino steps down due to 'personal reasons'
